Intel ® Integrated Performance Primitives
USC G728 codec

Overview
USC Codec description
 

Overview

The USC G728 speech codec is fully compliant with ITU-T G.728 with I, G, H Appendixes specifications for Low-Delay CELP coder promoted by International Telecommunication Union ( www.itu.org )  and has been implemented using the Intel ® Integrated Performance Primitives (Intel ® IPP) Speech Coding functions.  The USC G728 codec supports 16bit wideband 16000 Hz PCM signal compression with 20ms frame length at 9.6, 12.8 and 16 kbps producing 192, 256 and 320 bits per frame (bpf) .

Additional information on this software as well as other Intel ® Software Development Products is available at http://developer.intel.com/software/products/ .

USC Codec description

For USC Interface description refer to USC manual. 

 

USC G728 codec parameters:

  • Codec name: IPP_G728

  • Compression algorithm: Low-delay code excited linear prediction (LD-CELP).

  • Linkage: USC_G728_Fxns

  • Sampling rate: 16bit linear 16000 Hz

  • Frame: 20ms

  • Bitrates: 9600 bps (192 bpf), 12800 bps (256 bpf) and 16000 bps (320 bpf)

  • Voice Activity Detection: VAD not supported

  • Packet Loss Concealment: PLC supported

  • Frame types (value): Voice (0), Bad (1)

  • Standards: ITU-T G.728, Appendixes I, G, H
